newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE coffee see-saws to close up, NY gains eyed.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE coffee see-saws to close up, NY gains eyed.

text.p: London robusta coffee futures fluctuated but managed to close with pared gains after a late New York-inspired rally which helped reignited activity was not sustained, traders said.

"London was struggling for volume until New York started to move sharply," said one trader. Traders said the New York market took a spike higher after one major roaster was seen buying heavily into the market.
"This sparked some short covering in London, pulling the market higher," he said. But there was new fundamental news behind the rise.
London's May was driven to a session high of $1,561 a tonne but settled back at $1,545, still $17 higher.
Earlier, the contract spent the morning in negative territory, trading near the significant $1,500 support on origin hedge selling notably from the Far East.
But the slide towards $1,500 was met by good industry buying support.
Overall volume was 6,363 lots, dominated by AA trades in May and some crosses in March.
Chart-wise, analysts said coffee's recent uptrend could be coming to an end if the market makes enough of an attack on support.
The critical support on May coffee started at $1,500 and went down to around $1,430, Elli Gifford of Investment Research of Cambridge said earlier in the day.
Gifford noted particular support at around $1,465. "If that goes, I'd be inclined to abandon upside targets and assume the whole move was going to be reversed," she said.
Some traders thought the market was probably taking a pause after a near two-month bull run which took prices some 40-45 percent higher.
But they would not speculate on where it is heading next. "It's difficult to say where we go from here but I don't think it is picking up further steam again," said one physical trader.
